page.title: 16A View From The Water.
page.content: When we go out in my dad's boat we usually launch from the slipway near the{Itchen Bridge and Thornycroft Shipyard.We sail down river past the sewage works then we steer to port towards{Weston}Shore.We have to be careful at this point because at low tide we could get stuck in the mudflats.Behind Weston Shore stand six tower blocks,Havre,Oslo,Copenhagen, Rotterdam,Hampton and Canberra. Across the Southampton Water I can see Fawley Oil Refinery and Marchwood Power Station.We have to watch out for the many clam dredgers and the occasional hydrofoil or ferry but most of the traffic is yachting. Further along the shore we can see Netley castle amongst the trees and Weston sailing club.Sometimes it is difficult to sail through the racing fleets.
